meanings.definition: To make something mobile or capable of movement.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic was mobilizing the broken car for repair.
meanings.sent2: The workers were mobilizing the heavy boxes to the storage room.
meanings.sent3: The ants were mobilizing their food supplies for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The wind was mobilizing the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The children were mobilizing their toys for a playdate.

meanings.definition: To assemble or prepare for action or use.
meanings.sent1: The team was mobilizing for the big game.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were mobilizing for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent3: The students were mobilizing their study materials for the exam.
meanings.sent4: The chef was mobilizing the ingredients for the special dish.
meanings.sent5: The family was mobilizing for their annual vacation.

meanings.definition: To organize or coordinate resources for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The event planner was mobilizing the vendors for the festival.
meanings.sent2: The manager was mobilizing the team for the project deadline.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was mobilizing the students for the class presentation.
meanings.sent4: The community was mobilizing donations for the charity drive.
meanings.sent5: The coach was mobilizing the players for the championship match.
